Description: Terracotta fragment of figure plaque. Part of mould-made relief plaque. White coating preserved in patches. Pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Probably an East Greek figure plaque of early Hellenistic date. NA371, NA372, NA376 and NA813 all join. See also NA370 that is similar in style and subject. A Hellensitic East Greek example from Myrina was dated to the 2nd century BC (Mollard-Besques 1963: Pl.190 CA 1632; Pl.177, MYR 195, MYR 690 ) Mollard-Besques, S. 1963. ‘Catalogue raisonnédes figurines et reliefs en terre-cuite Grecs et Romains II: Myrina’. Paris: Musée National du Louvre.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.385) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 83, no. 71) (?)
